column2: Q1. Currently, do you allow personal devices in your classroom to be used by students for educational purposes on a daily basis?
column3: Q2. How important is the integration of technology to your everyday teaching practices?  (e.g., showing a YouTube video as an example, Google Classroom, Kahoot, etc.)
column4: Q3. Does your school have a phone policy?
column5: Q4. Under your school’s phone policy, when are students allowed to use their phones at school? Select all that apply.
column6: Q5. How does your school currently restrict access to phones? Select all that apply.
column7: Q6. Overall, how satisfied are you with your school's phone policy?
column8: Q7. How consistently do teachers and staff enforce your school's phone policy? Give your best guess.
column9: Q8. What percentage of your students are using their phone when they shouldn’t be? Give your best guess.
column10: Q9. In your opinion, should your school's phone policy be more or less restrictive than it is now?
column11: Q10. What challenges have you faced with implementing and/or enforcing the phone policy?
column12: Q11. Do you have any suggestions for overcoming those barriers?
